comments:
I just installed WTP (with GEF, EMF etc from the downloads link on the site). 
 
I'm trying to edit an xml file I had in a workspace and I cannot type into the 
source textviewer at all. I can modify the xml from the outline and do 
commands like "format" from the context menu, but every character I type into 
the text viewer fails.
This is the exception I get:

Wow! Can you confirm which "base" you're using? I just (re) tried with Eclipse
3.1 M4, and seems to work for me. I have not tested with recent I-build from
base, though.

If you are using Eclipse 3.1 M4 ... can you give some more details, such as what
type of project is the file in? Maybe attach a sample of the file?

Thanks!
From about screen:

--------------------------------------
Eclipse Platform

Version: 3.1.0
Build id: 200412162000
--------------------------------------

I'm pretty sure this is M4. If this works for everyone else, I guess one of my 
other plug-ins must be incompatible somehow with wtp. I can't even edit a file 
which I create using the new xml wizard (regardless whether I choose 
dtd/schema based or not).

I have a php (http://www.phpeclipse.de/tiki-view_articles.php) plug-in and 
Perforce (www.perforce.com) plug-in installed on top of the ones needed for 
wtp (gef, emf etc). The PHP plugin does have some xml based editing, but from 
the stack traces it doesn't seem to touch any of their code. I can't disable 
the php plug-in easily though it doesn't have a feature setup.

And just to be sure, I installed wtp-wst-1.0M2 (not sdk) and not the full wtp 
package if that makes some difference.

The problem looks like it's caused by the PHPeclipse plugins setting the default
document partitioner and SSE's IDocument implementation implementing the
"setting" incorrectly.  SSE's document connects the partitioner automatically
and that should be a separate step.

I can confirm that it works if I take out the php plug-in (except of course I 
loose my php editor ;)) 
 
It also affects editing xsd files. I didn't try xsl but those might be 
affected as well. 
Fixed in HEAD.  Updated BasicStructuredDocument and
BasicStructuredDocumentFactory, among others.  Fixing required an API addition
to org.eclipse.wst.sse.ui.style.IHighlighter to support and use IDocumentExtension3.
Changed Version field given new release numbering.
As component lead, I'm verifying this is fixed.
